question: Which of the following succeeded Visnuvardhana in the Eastern Chalukyan dynasty?
explanation: Visnuvardhana was succeeded by his son Maharaja Jayasimha I. He ruled from about 633 to 663 A.D.Â  It was during his reign that the Pallavas defeated Pulakesin II. They also occupied the southern part of his empire including the capital Badami.
